description:
Being the first female student council president isn't easy, especially when your school just transitioned from an all boys high school to a co-ed one. Aptly nicknamed "Demon President" by the boys for her strict disciplinary style, Misaki Ayuzawa is not afraid to use her mastery of Aikido techniques to cast judgment onto the hordes of misbehaving boys and defend the girls at Seika High School.

Yet even the perfect Ayuzawa has an embarrassing secret—she works part-time as a maid at a maid café to help her struggling family pay the bills. She has managed to keep her job hidden from her fellow students and maintained her flawless image as a stellar student until one day, Takumi Usui, the most popular boy in school, walks into the maid café. He could destroy her reputation with her secret... or he could twist the student council president around his little finger and use her secret as an opportunity to get closer to her.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Features a business that prepares and serves food and drinks to customers. Also encompasses cafes and bistros.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nojimakenji) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nojima_kenji/)__

Son of voice actor [Akio Nojima](https://anilist.co/staff/95918).
Younger brother of voice actor [Hirofumi Nojima](https://anilist.co/staff/95341).
Married to fellow voice actress [Chie Sawaguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/103731).

__Non-anime roles:__
- Albedo - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Caleb - Love and Deepspace (VG)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Official Website](http://zero.mods.jp/index.html) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/hirofujiwaralala/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/fuji_hiron) "Making manga has been my dream for as long as I can remember. I started seriously drawing manga art from my second year of middle school." Hiro Fujiwara is a Japanese manga artist. She was once active under the pen name Hiro Izumi (和泉ヒロ) at the end of the 1990s, but she abandoned the name after she won the Best Rookie award in the LMS for Kaeri Michi, Yuki no Netsu. Her first series, Kaichou wa Maid-sama!, was serialized in Hakusensha's monthly shoujo manga magazine LaLa. It was licensed in English, first by Tokyopop and later by Viz Media, and adapted into an anime television series in 2010. _Notice: Please, don't upload photos of herself, as she requested that any photos taken to not be distributed or uploaded online. Photos that include the face of "Hiro Fujiwara" are generally kept private in Japan._

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大塚舞)

Originating from [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). Currently freelance.

Aspired to become an animator after having seen [Densetsu no Yuusha Da Garn](https://anilist.co/anime/2803/).

heidi is an indie Japanese angura-kei band which started activities in early 2006.  There was a little "trouble" among the group when major debut, and forced to have an election (along with the live tour) for choosing the leader on June to July 2010.  In the end, Nao, the guitarist, is still the leader.  http://www.heidi-net.com/yokan/
__Birthplace:__ Ishikawa Prefecture, Japan __Maeguchi Wataru__ is a Japanese composer and arranger belonging to Smile Company.
__Birthplace:__ Ishikawa Prefecture, Japan __Maeguchi Wataru__ is a Japanese composer and arranger belonging to Smile Company.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/iyaiyaenn/)

She started working as animator for [Shin-Ei Douga](https://anilist.co/studio/247/ShinEi-Animation), where she later debuted as assistant episode director on [Yakyuukyou no Uta](https://anilist.co/anime/10554//) and [Ikkyuu-san](https://anilist.co/anime/4935/) before she became storyboarder and then episode director on the [Doraemon](https://anilist.co/anime/2471/Doraemon-1979/) television series. In 1982, when another former Shin-ei director, [Fukutomi Hiroshi](https://anilist.co/staff/105280/Hiroshi-Fukutomi), established [Animaru-Ya](https://anilist.co/studio/386/Animaruya) she was one of the founding members together with Sanada Yoshinobu and [Honda Toshiyuki](https://anilist.co/staff/129528/Toshiyuki--Honda). She stayed at Animaru-Ya, which is presently known as [Ekura Animaru](https://anilist.co/studio/6257/Ekura-Animal), until 2004 before leaving to work as freelancer.

(Source: aniDB)
